page.title: 11EARLY POTATOES AND DAIRYING
page.content: The farming in this area is{"mixed" mostly{early potatoes}and{dairying. Early potatoes were started by a small group of Pembrokeshire farmers because the conditions are suitable. The{potatoes}are planted in February and lifted in late May to June to command high prices. A new type of potato{"the Puffin"}has recently been introduced. Cheap{EEC and{Egyptian potatoes}are proving tough competition for local farmers. {Dairy farming}is very{specialised and farmers are extremely dedicated. The farmer has to list every animal in the herd; he draws the markings and records each calf's sex, date of birth and mother's pedigree. The cows graze in the summer months and are fed indoors on silage, barley and concentrates in the winter. by Elizabeth Edgington
